responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Unquoted search path in install-wp-tests.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh` uses unquoted paths in the `sed` commands, which could allow an attacker to inject malicious code or commands if the environment variables used in those paths contain spaces or other special characters.
    cwe: CWE-428
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper neutralization of special elements in assets/text-hover.js
    analysis: |
      The jQuery code in `assets/text-hover.js` uses the `title` attribute of HTML elements without properly sanitizing or escaping its contents. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious code (e.g., XSS) if the `title` attribute contains special characters or script code.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - assets/text-hover.js
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Hardcoded credentials in install-wp-tests.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh` includes hardcoded database credentials (username and password) passed as command-line arguments. If an attacker gains access to this script, they could potentially use these credentials to access the database.
    cwe: CWE-798
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Unquoted search path in install-wp-tests.sh
leads.analysis: The script tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh uses unquoted paths in the sed commands, which could allow an attacker to inject malicious code or commands if the environment variables used in those paths contain spaces or other special characters.

leads.headline: Improper neutralization of special elements in assets/text-hover.js
leads.analysis: The jQuery code in assets/text-hover.js uses the title attribute of HTML elements without properly sanitizing or escaping its contents. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious code (e.g., XSS) if the title attribute contains special characters or script code.

leads.headline: Hardcoded credentials in install-wp-tests.sh
leads.analysis: The script tests/bin/install-wp-tests.sh includes hardcoded database credentials (username and password) passed as command-line arguments. If an attacker gains access to this script, they could potentially use these credentials to access the database.
